alert.note: Alert for Crane; Pecos; Reeves County Plains; Upton; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 10:27PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN PECOS...SOUTHEASTERN REEVES...SOUTHEASTERN WARD...CRANE AND SOUTHWESTERN UPTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM CDT... At 1026 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Grandfalls, or 23 miles north of Fort Stockton, moving south at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Additionally, blowing dust may reduce visibility. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Fort Stockton, McCamey, Grandfalls, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport, Toyah Lake, Coyanosa, Imperial Reservoir, Pecos Municipal Airport, Upton County Airport, Girvin, Royalty, B F Goodrich Testing Track, Firestone Test Track, Imperial, and Cordona Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 221 and 293. Interstate 20 between mile markers 34 and 35, and between mile markers 39 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for western and southwestern Texas.

area.areaDesc: Crane; Pecos; Reeves County Plains; Upton; Ward
